datasets.name: result.csv
datasets.description: This dataset offers a detailed summary of the cluster annotations within the mouse brain, providing valuable insights into the number of clusters and cells associated with each annotation term. It serves as a key resource for understanding the distribution and prevalence of different cell types and their functional annotations in the brain.

raw.name: name
raw.description: This column contains the name of the cluster annotation, which represents the specific classification term applied to the cell cluster. These names are crucial for identifying and referencing the different categories used in the dataset, facilitating communication and analysis of the data.

raw.name: cluster_annotation_term_set_label
raw.description: This column provides a label for the term set used in annotation, indicating the source or type of classification applied. It helps in organizing and distinguishing between different sets of terms, ensuring clarity and consistency in the classification process.

raw.name: parent_term_label
raw.description: The parent term label identifies the overarching category or group to which a specific annotation term belongs. It provides context for the hierarchical classification, helping to understand the relationships and dependencies between different annotation terms.

raw.name: parent_term_set_label
raw.description: This column contains the label for the parent term set, which is used for organizing terms hierarchically. It serves as a reference point for understanding the structure and organization of the classification system, aiding in the interpretation and analysis of the data.

raw.name: term_set_order
raw.description: The term set order indicates the sequential arrangement of the term set, used for organizing data and ensuring a logical flow in the classification process. It provides a framework for navigating the dataset and understanding the progression of terms within the classification hierarchy.

raw.name: term_order
raw.description: This column specifies the order of the term within the set, indicating its position relative to other terms. It is essential for maintaining the structure and organization of the classification system, ensuring that terms are presented in a coherent and logical manner.

raw.name: cluster_annotation_term_set_name
raw.description: Similar to the pivot dataset, this column denotes the name of the annotation term set, specifying the type of classification applied to the clusters. It provides context for understanding the nature and scope of the annotations, aiding in the interpretation and analysis of the data.

raw.name: color_hex_triplet
raw.description: This column contains the color code used for visual representation of annotations. Color coding is an important tool for data visualization, enabling researchers to quickly and easily identify patterns, trends, and relationships within the dataset.

raw.name: number_of_clusters
raw.description: This column provides the number of clusters associated with each annotation term, offering insights into the prevalence and distribution of different cell types and their classifications within the brain. It is a key metric for understanding the diversity and complexity of the cellular landscape.

raw.name: number_of_cells
raw.description: This column indicates the number of cells associated with each annotation term, providing a quantitative measure of the abundance and representation of different cell types in the dataset. It is crucial for assessing the scale and scope of the annotations, informing analyses and interpretations of the data.

queries.question: Plot the number of clusters and cells for neurotransmitter.
